data.name: AnyCharacterWhichCanBeTypedRadioButtonText
data.value: Any character which can be typed
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: AnyCharacterWhichCanBeTypedRadioButtonToolTipText
data.value: Any upper-case letter, lower-case letter, number or symbol character can appear in the password. Spaces cannot appear in the password.
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: CopyToClipboardButtonText
data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.name: CreateNewPasswordWindowTitle

data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.comment: Used on the Help Window

data.name: DownloadReleaseButtonText
data.comment: Used on the Help Window

data.name: GeneratorNameAndVersionFormatString
data.comment: Used on the Help Window - {0} = Major Version Number, {1} = Minor Version Number, {2} = Revision Number

data.name: HelpButtonText
data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.name: HelpWindowTitle
data.comment: Used on the Help Window

data.name: LettersAndNumbersRadioButtonText
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: LettersAndNumbersRadioButtonToolTipText
data.value: Any upper-case letter, lower-case letter or number can appear in the password
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: MainWindowTitle
data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.name: NewlyCreatedAllCharacterPasswordHelpText
data.value: The newly created password may contain lower-case letters, upper-case letters and symbols. By default, some screen readers do not distinguish between character case and do not read every symbol. If you want to hear the entire password, you may need to use a feature which reads all characters and each letter’s case. Note that character case is important because it improves the password’s security. All of the characters and symbols in a generated password should be used because it makes the password more secure.
data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.name: NewlyCreatedAlphaNumericPasswordHelpText
data.value: The newly created password may contain lower-case and upper-case characters. Your screen reader may not distinguish between character case by default. Please configure it to do so if you want to copy down the password. Note using lower-case and upper-case characters in a password makes the password much more secure.
data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.name: NewlyCreatedPasswordLabel
data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.name: NewPasswordCharacterSetLabel
data.value: Characters which may be included in the new password
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: NewPasswordLengthLabel
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: NumbersRadioButtonText
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: NumbersRadioButtonToolTipText
data.value: Any number can appear in the password. These passwords are usually used for 4 to 6 number passwords called Personal Identification Numbers (PINs).
data.comment: Used on the Create New Password Window

data.name: OptionalAccountUsernameLabel
data.comment: Used on the Print Password window

data.name: OptionalUsernameTextBoxToolTip
data.value: Enter the username associated with this password. The username will be printed with the password when it is printed. The username will not be printed if this field is empty.
data.comment: Used on the Print Password window

data.name: OptionalWhatIsThisPasswordUsedForTextBoxToolTip
data.value: This box is used to describe where a password is used. For example, 'Amazon', 'This password is used to logon to my work PC' or 'https://www.amazon.com'. If this box is empty, the printed password does not state where it is used.
data.comment: Used on the Print Password window

data.name: PasswordAdviceButtonText
data.comment: Used on the Help Window

data.name: PasswordStrengthDescriptionLabel
data.comment: Used on the Main Window

data.name: PasswordStrengthLabel
data.comment: Used on the Main Window
